definitions: a member of an ancient Anatolian people whose empire was established around 1600 BCE and became a significant power in the Middle East
the extinct language of the Hittites, part of the Anatolian branch of Indo-European languages
examples: The Hittites were known for their advanced iron working techniques.
Hittite texts have provided insights into ancient law and diplomacy.
synonyms: Indo-European language (in the context of language)
